guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's code of conduct to ensure a respectful, inclusive, and harassment-free community for everyone.

guidelines.title: Creating Issues
guidelines.description: Before opening a new issue, search existing issues to avoid duplicates. Provide a clear and detailed description, including steps to reproduce any problems.

guidelines.title: Submitting Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Follow the project's coding standards and commit message guidelines. Include tests for new features or bug fixes and update documentation as needed.

guidelines.title: Branch Naming Conventions
guidelines.description: Use descriptive branch names that relate to the work being done. This helps in organizing and identifying the purpose of different branches.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Engage in code reviews by either receiving feedback gracefully or providing constructive feedback to others. This ensures high code quality and knowledge sharing.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Ensure that any relevant documentation is updated whenever a new feature is added or an existing feature is modified. This helps maintain accurate and useful documentation.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear, concise, and descriptive commit messages. Proper commit messages help in understanding the history and purpose of changes.

guidelines.title: Testing Code
guidelines.description: Ensure all code is tested thoroughly before submission. This helps in maintaining the stability and reliability of the project.

guidelines.title: Submit Issues
guidelines.description: Encourages developers to submit any bugs or feature requests through the project's issue tracker. This is important for tracking and addressing problems or new ideas.

guidelines.title: Fork and Clone Repository
guidelines.description: Instructs developers to fork the repository and clone it locally for making changes. This allows for safer, isolated development without affecting the main project.

guidelines.title: Create Feature Branch
guidelines.description: Advises developers to create a new branch for each new feature or bug fix. This keeps the main branch clean and makes it easier to manage multiple contributions.

guidelines.title: Commit Changes
guidelines.description: Details the process of committing changes to the new branch, ensuring that each commit is focused and meaningful. Well-organized commits make code review more efficient.

guidelines.title: Push Branch
guidelines.description: Guides developers on how to push their feature branches to their forked repository on GitHub. This is necessary for sharing the changes and opening pull requests.

guidelines.title: Open Pull Request
guidelines.description: Explains how to open a pull request from the feature branch to the main repository. This is the primary method for proposing changes to the project.

guidelines.title: Code Review
guidelines.description: Suggests that developers review each other's code before merging, which helps maintain code quality and ensures that multiple eyes have checked the contributions.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Encourages adherence to the project's coding standards and style guidelines. This ensures consistent code quality and readability across the project.

guidelines.title: Write Tests
guidelines.description: Emphasizes the importance of writing tests for new features or bug fixes to ensure they work correctly and do not break existing functionality.

guidelines.title: Update Documentation
guidelines.description: Reminds developers to update the project documentation with any relevant changes or additions, keeping it up-to-date and useful for future contributors.

guidelines.title: Review Existing Issues
guidelines.description: Before creating a new issue, review existing ones to avoid duplicates. This helps maintain an organized issue tracker and reduce redundancy.

guidelines.title: Write Clear Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Each commit message should be concise and descriptive, summarizing the changes made. Clear commit messages improve project traceability and make it easier to understand the project's history.

guidelines.title: Follow Code Style Guidelines
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's specific code style guidelines to maintain code consistency. This ensures the codebase remains clean and readable for all contributors.

guidelines.title: Create Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Use pull requests for contributing changes, as this allows for code review and discussion before merging. Pull requests facilitate collaboration and quality control.

guidelines.title: Write Tests for New Features
guidelines.description: Whenever new features are introduced, corresponding tests should be written to ensure the new code works as expected. This practice helps in maintaining code reliability and validity.

guidelines.title: Update Documentation
guidelines.description: When contributing new features or making changes, update the relevant documentation. Keeping the documentation up-to-date ensures that users and future contributors have accurate and useful information.

guidelines.title: Respect Community Rules
guidelines.description: Abide by the established community norms and rules, such as the code of conduct. This fosters a positive and inclusive environment for all contributors.

guidelines.title: Conduct Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews by giving and receiving constructive feedback. This practice enhances code quality and provides learning opportunities for all team members.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: The project outlines proper behavior and expectations for all contributors, ensuring respectful and inclusive interactions among everyone involved.

guidelines.title: Bug Reports
guidelines.description: Instructions on how to file detailed bug reports, including necessary information such as environment, steps to reproduce, and expected behavior for effective issue tracking and resolution.

guidelines.title: Feature Requests
guidelines.description: Guidelines for proposing new features, encouraging contributors to describe the benefits and potential impact on the project before submission.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Detailed instructions on how to submit pull requests, including how to properly fork the repository, make changes in a separate branch, and ensure compliance with coding standards and tests.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Standards for writing clear and concise commit messages, helping maintain a clean and understandable project history.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Description of the coding style and best practices to be followed by all contributors to ensure consistency across the project.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Guidelines on writing and running tests before submitting contributions to maintain the project's reliability and quality.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Contributors are expected to adhere to the project's code of conduct, which ensures a welcoming and inclusive community for all participants.

guidelines.title: Reporting Bugs
guidelines.description: Instructions on how to report bugs, detailing that contributors should include a clear and detailed description of the issue, steps to reproduce it, and any relevant logs or screenshots.

guidelines.title: Feature Requests
guidelines.description: Guidelines on submitting feature requests, advising contributors to thoroughly describe the desired feature, its benefits, and any potential drawbacks or considerations.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Directions for submitting pull requests, including requirements for descriptive titles and detailed descriptions, as well as ensuring that the code follows the project's style guidelines and passes all tests.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Standards that contributors should follow when writing code, typically including adherence to style guides, best practices, and maintaining consistency with the existing codebase.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Requirements for writing and running tests, ensuring that new code is adequately tested and that existing tests continue to pass.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Expectations for maintaining and updating documentation, including the addition of docstrings, README updates, and usage examples as necessary.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: An outline of the review process for contributions, including how to address feedback and the typical timeline for reviews.
